description.public: A flask filled with a reddish liquid explodes when it breaks open, creating a small explosive fire that quickly dissipates.
description.private: Primarily used to break apart large pieces of ore, these alchemical flasks pack a concentrated punch. If combined in a large enough quantity, they can also be used to create a chain reaction that results in larger explosions.

blastFlask.name: Blast Flask
blastFlask.description:
You light and throw the @ref[name], dealing Fire damage to all enemies in the radius of the explosion. The radius of the Blast depends on the quality of the bomb:

  • Shoddy - 3 feet

  • Standard - 4 feet

  • Fine - 6 feet

  • Superior - 8 feet

  • Masterwork - 10 feet

description.public: A flammable concoction that ignites upon impact and burns intensely for a short time.

alchemistsFire.name: Alchemist's Fire
alchemistsFire.description:
You hurl the @ref[name], dealing Weakened immediate damage but causing the @Condition[burning] condition to all enemies in a 4 foot radius Blast who fail to avoid the attack.

The amount of burning damage and its duration is dependent on the quality of the @ref[name]:

  • Shoddy - 2 damage for 2 rounds

  • Standard - 3 damage for 3 rounds

  • Fine - 4 damage for 4 rounds

  • Superior - 6 damage for 5 rounds

  • Masterwork - 8 damage for 6 rounds

description.public:
This brightly colored necklace holds a stone amulet that glows with a rune that crackles faintly with electrical resonance. While holding it you have the surreal sensation of the world around you slowing down ever so slightly.

This amulet provides a bonus to Reflex defense equal to the minimum of its Quality and Enchantment bonuses.

  • Fine quality and Minor enchantment: +1 Reflex

  • Superior quality and Major enchantment: +2 Reflex

  • Masterwork quality and Legendary enchantment: +3 Reflex
description.private: This item is presented as an amulet, but it can be any type of accessory like a ring, cloak, bracers, or other type of trinket.

description.public: A slender phial that contains a slightly golden-colored liquid. It smells foul, but contains the alchemical agents necessary to neutralize a wide variety of toxins.

antitoxin.name: Antitoxin
antitoxin.description:
Consuming this @ref[name] is able to neutralize any @Condition[poisoned] conditions affecting the target. Stronger poisons require a stronger antitoxin to neutralize.

The category of poison negated by this @ref[name] depends on its quality:

  • Shoddy - Poisons dealing 3 damage or less per round

  • Standard - Poisons dealing 5 damage or less per round

  • Fine - Poisons dealing 7 damage or less per round

  • Superior - Poisons dealing 9 damage or less per round

  • Masterwork - Poisons dealing 11 damage or less per round

description.public: A sphere of crystal or glass that — in the palm of a capable spellcaster — becomes a conduit for their power. It gathers voltaic energy within its orb before blasting a target with electrifying force.
This spectacularly worked satchel features elaborate ornamentation that makes it clear it is no simple pack. While Equipped and Invested, your carrying capacity is tripled.

A bastard sword, also known as a hand-and-a-half sword, is a versatile weapon with a straight, double-edged blade around 40 inches long. This weapon is forged for both single-handed agility and two-handed power.
A heavy, crescent-bladed weapon built for cleaving through armor and bone alike. Its haft is marked from countless blows. This weapon can be gripped either in one hand or two.
A coat or vest of cloth or leather lined with small, riveted steel plates hidden inside, brigandine is favored by mercenaries and guards for its impressive mix of flexibility and solid defense.
A small, round metal shield roughly the size of a dinner plate, the buckler is a duelist’s tool for deflecting blades and controlling space, worn on the forearm or gripped like a weapon.
Corrosive liquid swirls within this vial of intentionally thin glass, designed to shatter on impact and spill the caustic substance upon a target.

causticPhial.name: Caustic Phial
causticPhial.description:
You fling the @ref[name], dealing Weakened immediate damage but causing the @Condition[corroding] condition to all enemies in a 4 foot radius Blast who fail to avoid the attack.

The amount of burning damage and its duration is dependent on the quality of the @ref[name]:

  • Shoddy - 2 damage for 2 rounds

  • Standard - 3 damage for 3 rounds

  • Fine - 4 damage for 4 rounds

  • Superior - 6 damage for 5 rounds

  • Masterwork - 8 damage for 6 rounds

description.public: This blade is less functional and more ornamented than a regular dagger. Its inscriptions and craftsmanship are purposeful for use as a tool for spellcraft. In combat, it projects piercing blasts of arcane energy.
A sturdy and flexible chain affixed with a barbed hook at its end. In the hands of a skilled combatant the chain can be thrown towards a target, tearing at their flesh or equipment.
A mesh of interlinked steel rings worn over padding, chain mail provides excellent protection against cuts and decent defense against thrusts, though it distributes weight across the whole body.

This charm-covered necklace looks rustic, but upon close inspection you notice a delicate craft imbued within its workmanship. While holding it you feel your breaths deepen and the minor aches within your muscles dissipate.

This amulet provides a bonus to Fortitude defense equal to the minimum of its Quality and Enchantment bonuses.

  • Fine quality and Minor enchantment: +1 Fortitude

  • Superior quality and Major enchantment: +2 Fortitude

  • Masterwork quality and Legendary enchantment: +3 Fortitude
A seemingly humble tool with a flat striking face and curved claw, the claw hammer can become a savage weapon in determined hands.
Worn over the hands like a second set of talons, claw weapons—be they steel extensions or bone-forged monstrosities—rip and tear in savage, rapid slashes.
A crude yet effective weapon, the club is a blunt length of wood or bone designed to crush rather than cut. It can be a dangerous implement in the hands of even untrained fighters.
A slightly curved bar of strong metal featuring a hook with a flattened head on one end. Used to apply leverage, prying one object loose of another.
Small, swift, and deadly, the dagger slips between ribs or into gaps in armor with ease, its wicked edge favored by assassins, thieves, and those who prefer a silent kill.
A compact, tubular weapon designed to silently launch small, often poisoned projectiles, the dart gun is favored by assassins, beast handlers, and shadowy alchemists.

An expanded toolbelt in the form of a utility belt, a bandolier, or an array of pockets stitched into your equipment.

This item provides a number of additional Toolbelt slots according to its quality tier:

  • Standard: +1 Toolbelt slot

  • Fine: +2 Toolbelt slots

  • Superior: +3 Toolbelt slots

  • Masterwork: +4 Toolbelt slots
This mage staff is a talisman to assist with spellcraft or hurl gouts of arcane flame at enemies.
A polearm with a curved, sword-like blade affixed to the end of a long shaft, the glaive sweeps through foes in broad, arcing strikes.
This two-handed behemoth features a massive head of iron or stone, used to crush armor, bone, and will alike with every thunderous blow.
A towering weapon with a broad, often double-bladed head, the greataxe is made for delivering devastating cleaves, hewing men and beasts with terrible force.
A gnarled length of heavy wood, sometimes studded with iron, the greatclub is a crude but fearsome weapon is dangerous even in untrained hands.
Longer and heavier than a standard longsword, the greatsword is a two-handed blade meant for powerful sweeping strikes, its length commanding both reach and awe.
This heavy tome is used as a repository of knowledge as well as an implement for spellcraft. In the hands of an arcane practitioner, it can project concussive blasts of force towards a target.
Combining an axe blade, a spear point, and a hook on a single pole, the halberd is a versatile weapon capable of stabbing, cleaving, or trapping weapons for counter-attacks.
Compact and deadly, the hand axe is a one-handed chopper with a short haft and sharp blade, ideal for throwing or close-quarters strikes where speed outmatches reach.
This palm-sized crossbow trades power for concealability, perfect for close-quarters surprise shots or the desperate last bolt of a cornered rogue.
This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to rapidly close wounds and improve bodily health.

healingElixir.name: Healing Elixir
healingElixir.description:
Immediately recover an amount of Health dependant on the quality of the elixir.

  • Shoddy - Immediately heals 6 Health.

  • Standard - Immediately heals 12 Health.

  • Fine - Immediately heals 24 Health.

  • Superior - Immediately heals 48 Health.

  • Masterwork - Immediately heals 96 Health.

description.public: This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to gradually close wounds and improve bodily health.

healingTonic.name: Healing Tonic
healingTonic.description:
Immediately, and at the beginning of each of the next 5 Rounds, recover an amount of Health dependent on the quality of the tonic.

  • Shoddy - Heals 2 Health each Round

  • Standard - Heals 4 Health each Round

  • Fine - Heals 8 Health each Round

  • Superior - Heals 16 Health each Round

  • Masterwork - Heals 32 Health each Round

description.public: Named for its iron shape resembling the base of a clothes iron, the heater shield offers a balance of coverage and mobility.
A powerful, steel-limbed crossbow requiring a crank or lever to draw, it delivers devastating bolts capable of punching through armor or pinning enemies to walls.
Toughened skins from large beasts or monsters, these rugged armors are worn by hunters and wildfolk, offering durable—but crude—defense in the field.
This talisman is a visible proclamation of its wielder's faith and the power it bestows upon them. In combat it can be used to project a searing beam of radiant light towards an enemy.
description.private: The type of damage dealt by this talisman can be tailored to the domain of whichever deity its weilder worships.

description.public: This mage staff is a talisman to assist with spellcraft or hurl blasts of frigid ice towards enemies.
With a sharp metal head mounted atop a long pole, the javelin is light enough to be thrown but sturdy enough to remain useful in close quarters.
Forged with painstaking precision, the katana is a single-edged, curved blade of folded steel, its deadly grace a reflection of its wielder's discipline.
A punch-dagger with a straight blade and horizontal grip, the katar drives forward with brutal force, designed to pierce armor and guts with a single, direct thrust.
Tall and tapered for full-body protection, the kite shield curves around the wielder’s body and is favored by cavalry and infantry alike for its excellent coverage and iconic silhouette.
An oil-burning or magically illuminated lantern that sheds bright light in a 20 foot radius and dim light in a 40 foot radius.
Crafted from thick, boiled leather hardened into panels or a cuirass, leather armor offers lightweight protection ideal for scouts, rogues, and lightly armed skirmishers.
A tall, self-bow often taller than the archer who draws it, the longbow requires great strength and years of practice to master, sending arrows with deadly force across the battlefield.
The longsword is a double-edged blade wielded with two hands for balance and strength, usually featuring a large crossguard used for parrying blows.
A one-handed blunt weapon that features a heavy head, typically forged of metal, which converts the momentum of its wielder's swing into a bone-shattering impact.

A small brass coin with a broad, grinning face and little red garnet eyes. The coin is stamped with a specific sequence of sigils that link it with a sibling coin, allowing the two holders to communicate over vast distances.

If you hold the coin and speak to it, the coin immediately connects its sibling and begins speaking loudly, relaying what you're saying and what is said back. The connection lasts for up to 1 minute before the connection breaks. Each coin can be used once per long rest.

The coin may be used 5 times after which its magic fades, becoming nearly worthless.
Consisting of quilted layers of cloth stuffed with rags or wool, padded armor cushions the body against blunt force and serves as the foundation beneath heavier gear.

A graceful silver amulet embedded with blue jewels imbues you with a feeling of steadfastness while you clutch it, prepared to weather any challenge.

This amulet provides a bonus to Willpower defense equal to the minimum of its Quality and Enchantment bonuses.

  • Fine quality and Minor enchantment: +1 Willpower

  • Superior quality and Major enchantment: +2 Willpower

  • Masterwork quality and Legendary enchantment: +3 Willpower
description.private: This item is presented as an amulet, but it can be any type of accessory like a ring, cloak, bracers, or other type of trinket.

description.public: A crescent spike mounted atop a sturdy haft, the pickaxe is conventionally a mining implement, but can be wielded in combat to deliver dangerous piercing blows.
An early black powder firearm with a single, thunderous shot, the flintlock pistol is a gambler’s weapon—deadly in a flash, but slow to reload in the chaos of battle.
The pinnacle of personal protection, plate mail encases the body in carefully fitted steel plates, offering near-complete protection while allowing impressive mobility for a trained wearer.
This small vial contains murky liquid that is noticeably thicker than water. It emits a disconcerting scent that evokes a sense of wrongness.

poisonIngest.name: Ingest Poison
poisonIngest.description:
When this toxin is ingested or otherwise enters the bloodstream of a creature, it is initially Harmless, but the target must defend an attack against its Fortitude or become @Condition[poisoned].

The amount of poison damage and its duration is dependent on the quality of the @ref[name]:

  • Shoddy - 2 damage for 4 rounds

  • Standard - 4 damage for 6 rounds

  • Fine - 6 damage for 8 rounds

  • Superior - 8 damage for 10 rounds

  • Masterwork - 10 damage for 12 rounds

This action should be used when the poison is ingested rather than when it is first applied.

poisonApply.name: Apply Poison
poisonApply.description:
The contents of this vial can be added to food, drink, smeared upon a bladed weapon, or combined with some alternative delivery mechanism.

This action, which consumes the available usage of the poison, should be used when it is first applied.

description.public: This talisman, favored by druidic adherants attuned to the power of the land, aids in the practice of spellcraft or can be used in combat to direct a gout of poisonous spores towards an enemy.
A simple wooden staff around six to eight feet long, the quarterstaff is a deceptively balanced weapon that can be deadly in trained hands.
This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to rapidly fortify the psyche and improve morale.

rallyingElixir.name: Rallying Elixir
rallyingElixir.description:
Immediately recover an amount of Morale dependant on the quality of the elixir.

  • Shoddy - Immediately heals 6 Morale.

  • Standard - Immediately heals 12 Morale.

  • Fine - Immediately heals 24 Morale.

  • Superior - Immediately heals 48 Morale.

  • Masterwork - Immediately heals 96 Morale.

description.public: This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to gradually fortify the psyche and improve morale.

rallyingTonic.name: Rallying Tonic
rallyingTonic.description:
Immediately, and at the beginning of each of the next 5 Rounds, recover an amount of Morale dependent on the quality of the tonic.

  • Shoddy - Heals 2 Morale each Round

  • Standard - Heals 4 Morale each Round

  • Fine - Heals 8 Morale each Round

  • Superior - Heals 16 Morale each Round

  • Masterwork - Heals 32 Morale each Round

description.public: Long, slender, and exquisitely balanced, the rapier is a fencer’s weapon of choice, its needle-point tip perfect for lightning-fast thrusts and deadly duels.
Ring mail features metal rings sewn onto a padded base, offering a compromise of less protection than heavier mail options in exchange for greater mobility.

This elegant ornamented ring feels slightly slick and difficult to grasp. While held it vibrates almost imperceptibly.

This ring provides a bonus to Dodge defense equal to the minimum of its Quality and Enchantment bonuses.

  • Fine quality and Minor enchantment: +1 Dodge

  • Superior quality and Major enchantment: +2 Dodge

  • Masterwork quality and Legendary enchantment: +3 Dodge
description.private: This item is presented as a ring, but it can be any type of accessory like an amulet, cloak, bracers, or other type of trinket.

description.public:
This steel ring feels permanently cool to the touch and gives the sensation of weighing more than expected given its narrow band.

This ring provides a bonus to Armor defense equal to the minimum of its Quality and Enchantment bonuses.

  • Fine quality and Minor enchantment: +1 Armor

  • Superior quality and Major enchantment: +2 Armor

  • Masterwork quality and Legendary enchantment: +3 Armor
description.private: This item is presented as a ring, but it can be any type of accessory like an amulet, cloak, bracers, or other type of trinket.

description.public: A round metal shield nearly two feet in diameter which is the basic defensive armament of foot soldiers lacking specialized training in shield combat.
A trident-shaped weapon with blunt prongs and a pointed shaft, the sai is a tool of precision and control, used to trap blades and strike with a flicker of disciplined fury.
Overlapping metal plates sewn or riveted onto a leather or cloth backing, scale mail resembles the hide of a dragon and protects well against cuts and stabs—though it's noisy and inflexible.
With its wide, curved blade and deadly arc, the scimitar dances through battle, its edge carving through foes in sweeping, elegant strikes.
Compact and quick to draw, the shortbow excels in rapid, close-quarters archery and skirmishes, favored by scouts, hunters, and swift-footed raiders.
The shortsword is a straight-bladed weapon which is nimble to wield and quick to strike in close combat. It features a crossguard ideal for parrying incoming blows.
This macabre talisman invokes the fear and energies of death to aid spellcaft or afflict enemies with corrupting influence.
A deceptively simple length of cord or leather used to hurl stones at high velocity, the sling is one of the oldest weapons in history—requiring skill, but deadly in trained hands.
A weapon of reach and rhythm, the spear features a long shaft tipped with steel, perfect for holding the line or launching with deadly force from behind a shield wall.
This ring made of an opaque stone that has been carefully carved with graceful, sweeping layers evoking an ancient aesthetic. The ring serves as a powerful spellcasting focus for the Invested wearer.

spellband.name: Spellband
spellband.description:
In moments of duress you can withdraw an additional reserve of Focus from this band. The amount of Focus restored depends on the enchantment bonus of the ring.

  • Minor enchantment: 4 Focus

  • Major enchantment: 6 Focus

  • Legendary enchantment: 8 Focus

description.public: The gnarled length of heavy wood has been embedded with vicious protruding spikes, making it even more formidable and savage in the blows it delivers at the expense of its excess bulk.
A brutal blend of fist weapon and piercing tool, spiked knuckles turn every punch into a maiming blow, ideal for brawlers who want their fists to draw blood and fear.
A layer of vertical metal strips riveted to a backing of leather or mail, splint armor offers strong limb protection while sacrificing some flexibility.
Thin, tapered, and made for piercing, the stiletto is a killer’s weapon — designed to slide between ribs or gaps in armor and leave barely a trace.
A base of leather reinforced with small metal studs or riveted plates, this armor strikes a balance between mobility and modest protection against slashes.
Able to be used as either a light source or as an improvised weapon, a torch can illuminate dark places and ward off the foes that lurk there.
A massive, rectangular wall of wood and metal, the tower shield turns its bearer into a walking fortress, ideal for holding choke points—but at the cost of speed and vision.
Built to crush plate and shatter shields, the war hammer features a heavy, blunt head mounted atop a reinforced haft, delivering ruin in the hands of those who favor power over finesse.
Designed for mounted combat, the war lance is a long, tapered weapon used to shatter armor with the momentum of a charging steed, its shaft reinforced for devastating impact.
